tools.name: mcp_CalendarTools_graph_createEvent
tools.description: Use this to create a new event in current user's calendar. IMPORTANT: If recipient names are provided instead of email addresses, you MUST first search for users to find their email addresses..If time is provided, schedule the event — even if there are conflicts/ even if attendee/organizer is busy in that slot.If only a date is given, use the earliest slot where all or most attendees (> 50% of them) are free. If no date is given, schedule meeting at given time for today.If no time/date is given, use the first slot where all attendees are free.Try to create events during working hours of signed-in user (8 AM – 5 PM) if explicit time is not specified.Specify recurrence using recurrence property.Online meetings can be created by setting isOnlineMeeting to true.Default meeting duration is 30 minutes, if not specified by user.

userId.description: The user's object ID (GUID) or userPrincipalName (email-like UPN). Use the organizer's mailbox you intend to create the event in; do not pass display names.

subject.description: Non-empty event subject/title. Avoid trailing whitespace and control characters.

body.description: Event body/description content. Use 'html' for rich formatting or 'text' for plain.

contentType.description: Body content type. If unsure, use 'Text'.

content.description: Body content string. For 'html', provide well-formed HTML; for 'text', provide plain UTF-8 text.

start.description: Event start timestamp with time zone. Must be before 'end'.

dateTime.description: Local start time in ISO 8601 without offset: 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss' (e.g., '2025-09-18T09:00:00').

timeZone.description: Time zone identifier for start time. Use the organizer's mailbox zone if known.

end.description: Event end timestamp with time zone. Must be after 'start'.

dateTime.description: Local end time in ISO 8601 without offset: 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss' (e.g., '2025-09-18T10:00:00').

timeZone.description: Time zone identifier of 'dateTime'. Use the same system as 'start.timeZone' for consistency.

location.description: Primary location for the event. Use a concise name (e.g., room name, address, or 'Microsoft Teams Meeting').

displayName.description: Human-readable location label (e.g., 'Conf Room 12A', '1 Microsoft Way, Redmond', or 'Teams Meeting').

attendees_addresses.description: Email addresses of attendees. Each must be a valid email address.

attendees_types.description: Attendee roles corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each type applies to the attendee at the same index.

attendees_names.description: Display names of attendees corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each name applies to the attendee at the same index.

recurrence.description: Recurrence specification. Provide both 'pattern' and 'range'. Omit for one-time events.

interval.description: The time interval between occurrences (e.g., every 2 weeks)

daysOfWeek.description: Days of the week for recurrence, if applicable

dayOfMonth.description: Day of the month for monthly pattern

startDate.description: The start date of the recurrence (yyyy-MM-dd)

endDate.description: The end date of the recurrence (yyyy-MM-dd)

numberOfOccurrences.description: The number of times the event occurs

allowNewTimeProposals.description: Whether invitees can propose a new time. Defaults to true if omitted.

transactionId.description: Optional unique client-provided identifier to ensure idempotence

isOnlineMeeting.description: Set to true to create an online meeting. Defaults to false.

onlineMeetingProvider.description: Online meeting provider. REQUIRED when 'isOnlineMeeting' = true; omit otherwise.

tools.name: mcp_CalendarTools_graph_listEvents
tools.description: Retrieve a list of events in a user's calendar.For recurring meetings, only return one / first record with full recurrence details (pattern, start, end) to the agent.For searching by meeting title, filter using contains(subject,'X'); avoid 'eq' or startswith(subject,'X') filter for this case.Use this tool to find existing meetings whenever the user refers to a meeting by day, date, time , or title (e.g., “add someone to the architecture review at 2 PM”), before calling any tool that modifies, updates, or cancels a meeting.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user whose calendar events will be retrieved.

startDateTime.description: The start of the time range for the events (ISO 8601 format).

endDateTime.description: The end of the time range for the events (ISO 8601 format).

top.description: The maximum number of events to return.

filter.description: OData filter query to filter events.

orderby.description: OData order by query to sort events.

tools.name: sendMail
tools.description: Create and send an email with optional attachments. Supports both file URIs (OneDrive/SharePoint) and direct file uploads (base64-encoded). IMPORTANT: If recipient names are provided instead of email addresses, you MUST first search for users to find their email addresses.

to.description: List of To recipients (MUST be email addresses - if you only have names, search for users first to get their email addresses)

cc.description: List of Cc recipients (MUST be email addresses - if you only have names, search for users first to get their email addresses)

bcc.description: List of Bcc recipients (MUST be email addresses - if you only have names, search for users first to get their email addresses)

attachmentUris.description: List of direct file URIs to attach (must be Microsoft 365 file links: OneDrive, SharePoint, Teams, or Graph /drives/{id}/items/{id}).

tools.name: SearchMessages
tools.description: Search Outlook messages using Microsoft Graph Search API with KQL-style queries.

from.description: Zero-based offset of the first result

enableTopResults.description: If true, returns top results with relevance boosting
